question: Renal Ultrsound shows two stones sizes of  0.4cmx0.1cm, 0.5cmx0.3cm in upper pole.Blood test shows 8.8 g/dL of protein , Phosphorus 4.9 mg/dLUrinalysis test shows Nitrits-positiveBut I rarely have a symptom.  Do I need to remove stones now?1. ESWL(shock wave) procedure-causes possible longterm kidney damage,  fourtimes higher chances to develope diabetes, hypertension.2. Ureteroscope-not applicable3. Nephroscopic procedure-causes infections, lessened kidney functionwhat is the safest(almost zero side effects) procedure?   Please ! correct my knowledge  If these are not right.
title: scared of kidney stone surgery
